tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE vpn_configuration_settings (
	id INT PRIMARY KEY,
	server_name VARCHAR(50),
	server_ip VARCHAR(15),
	protocol VARCHAR(10),
	encryption_method VARCHAR(20),
	max_users INT
)

CREATE TABLE vpn_servers (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  server_name VARCHAR(50),
  server_ip VARCHAR(15),
  port INT,
  is_active BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE vpn_settings (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  vpn_id INT,
  setting_name VARCHAR(50),
  setting_value TEXT,
  FOREIGN KEY (vpn_id) REFERENCES vpn_servers(id)
);

CREATE TABLE vpn_clients (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    client_name VARCHAR,
    client_ip VARCHAR,
    connected_server_id UUID,
    FOREIGN KEY (connected_server_id) REFERENCES vpn_servers(id)
);

CREATE TABLE vpn_configuration (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    server_id UUID,
    setting_name VARCHAR,
    setting_value VARCHAR,
    FOREIGN KEY (server_id) REFERENCES vpn_servers(id)
);

CREATE TABLE VPN_Clients (
    client_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    client_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    client_ip VARCHAR(15) NOT NULL,
    client_location VARCHAR(50),
    last_login TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE VPN_Logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    server_id INT REFERENCES VPN_Servers(server_id),
    client_id INT REFERENCES VPN_Clients(client_id),
    log_message TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE VPN_Server_Configurations (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    server_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    ip_address VARCHAR(15) NOT NULL,
    port INTEGER NOT NULL,
    encryption_key TEXT
);
